column4: formerly a longtime resident of englewood
column8: 2015. rodger was a graduate of warren g. harding high school
column9: the general motors institute and case institute of technology. he retired from general motors following 40 years of service. rodger was a veteran of the u. s. army. he was a member of the sons of the american revolution (sar)
column10: and had been an active member of concord united methodist church. rodger has a passion for scouting
column11: he attained the designation of eagle scout as a youth
column12: and later was presented with the boy scouts silver antelope and silver beaver awards. he attended the 13th world jamboree in france in 1947 and in 2013 received the national eagle scout association outstanding eagle scout award. rodger was also involved with the heritage society
column13: the mayflower society and was a member of the northmont optimist club. one of rodgers life long passions was photography and he enjoyed sharing that with others. he is survived by his wife of 61years: eleanor h. (huff) moore
column31: great grandchildren: nolan and amelia smith
column38: relatives and many friends. he was preceded in death by his parents: leland and mary (peterson) moore. funeral services will be held at 10:00 a. m. on saturday
column40: 2015 at the kindred funeral home (400 union blvd.
column41: englewood) with rev. dr. steve gill and chaplain david snowdon officiating. interment will be at concord church cemetery in englewood. the family will receive friends on friday from 5:00 to 7:00 p. m. at the funeral home. if desired
column42: memorial contributions may be made to the miami valley council boy scouts of america or to boy scout troop #55. online condolences may be sent to the family at www. kindred. funeralhome. comupcoming events. visitationjun 12. 5:00 pm - 7:00 pm kindred funeral home400 union boulevard. englewood
